txt.en: Instance: Bonds of Oak and Iron
'Frerin must be in these woods somewhere....'
'Hah! Didn't I kill you already, greybeard?'
'Graaah! Where did you find that, you little rat?!'
'You think that little stick is going to save you, dwarf?!'
'Still got some fight in you, eh? I'll take your head!'
'Just... die already... you worthless little...'
'Hmmph.'
'Wait... what is that?'
'Do you see that glint, Hermáth?'
'Urro!'
A wild blow from Urro knocks you to the ground and you black out...
'Oh, we're not finished... after all, I have something of yours!'
As you regain your bearings, you find Thorin and Urro still in heated battle!
As Thorin makes for Urro, even more Orcs rush onto the field!
'You want this grubby old hand? Not unless you take it from me, Urro!'
'Leave this one to me, Hermáth. Help Thorin!'
'Brother!'
'What have you done, reek-beards?! I'll have your-'
DNT - INSERT SHIELDBREAK HERE
'Nar! You'll pay for this!'
'You... have my... thanks, friend Zhélruka.'
'Azog! AZOG!'
'Frerin left me in the mud to die! Does that sound like victory to you?'
'What then? You would risk Frerin's life to settle this score?'
'Keep a keen eye, Thromur! We will find him!'
'You would risk the entire vanguard to soothe your petty bitterness?'
'Maybe I'll take you alive... let my father have some fun with you!'
'The Horn of Grór! The Iron-folk come at last! Ha-ha!'
'These tracks are fresh, and by their bearing, they lead toward Durin's Stone.'
'Let us follow them and aid our kinsfolk!'
'Over there! I think I see them!'
'Azog did not answer at the gates, so we pried them loose...'
To your dismay, you find Shálun bloodied and gasping for breath beneath Urro
'...but it was a trap. His Orcs encircled us, and drove us back into the woods!'
'So many fell in the retreat... even my son, Frerin....'
'It was Urro....'
'When Frerin challenged Urro, I was atop a nearby hill.'
'Thorin... he drew Urro off! Where... where is my son?'
'Even I must admit that Frerin fought bravely, but Urro soon overpowered him.'
'Let... me up, Farin! Thorin... needs me!'
'Bah! Frerin should not need some magic Orc-hand to win his battles!'
'As Urro loomed above Frerin, I let loose a great cry and ran down to meet him in battle!'
'Urro was distracted for but a moment, but it was enough!'
'You old fool! Do you not see?'
'I.... We must return the hand to Frerin!'
'Just as Urro turned and raised his sword against me, the hand that wielded it was severed by Frerin's axe.'
'A victory for one dwarf is a victory for us all!'
'Come! We have no time to waste!'
'Even so, Urro's blade sank deep into my thigh as it fell.'
'Wounded, Urro fled, and Frerin and I collapsed beside each other.'
'Frerin was borne up on the shields of his kinsfolk and hailed as a hero.'
'As for me, I lay forgotten on the ground, my blood seeping into the cold mud of Elderslade.'
'We had defeated Urro together, or so I thought.'
'King Thráin! Are you all right? What has happened?!'
'Had I not attacked when I did, it would have meant Frerin's death.'
'Oh, master Frerin! No....'
'Oh, Fundin....'
'But no... he didn't offer me even one word of thanks!'
'Even you don't believe that, Shálun.'
'Urro's hand bears no enchantment! It brings us hope, and that is all.'
'But by stealing it away, you have robbed Frerin... robbed all of us of that hope!'
'Isn't that right, Hermáth?'
'A coward, you say? You know nothing, stripling.'
'By the looks of it, I have shed more blood for Thráin than you have!'
'Nar! Enough foolin' around!'
'What then do you call taking something that does not belong to you?'
'And a thief?! I am no such thing!'
'I know you have it! You took my master Frerin's trophy!'
'Good eye, Thromur! Let's go!'
'His trophy? You mean the hand of Urro!? Hah!'
'I will find and protect your son, King Thráin. I swear it!'
'It is as much my trophy as it is his!'
'Urro slew my brother... he will not get away. Not this time!'
'I am not of your House, but I will do what I might.'
'So! You are not only a thief but a coward as well!'
'Let us help your friend and put an end to Urro!'
'Follow me, Hermáth. I have something to return to Urro!'
'What do you have to say for yourself, Shálun?!'
'Leave him, Urro, or losing another hand will be the least of your troubles!'
'Follow me!'
'Even if you could stand, I would not let you, my King. You must keep off that leg!'
